page.title: 12ECONOMICS, WATER SUPPY
page.content: During the nineteen fifties and sixties the Usk River Authority explored the possibility of creating a reservoir in part of the Senni valley. This scheme was finally abandoned in 1973. It seems unlikely that the proposal will be renewed with -out considerable local and national opposition. The National Park Plan published in 1977 has argued strongly against further reservoir construction within the Brecon Beacons National Park. The period of uncertainty about the future of the valley obviously affected farming practice, resulting in a period of inaction when there was not much long-term improvement carried out on either land or buildings.Many smaller cottages were at that time sold for use as country cottages or "second homes".
